page.title: 04DALDOWIE CREMATORIUM
page.content: {DALDOWIE CREMATORIUM}was built by Lanarkshire in 1955.There is a hall of remembrance with stained glass windows of the coats of arms of the burghs, which contributed to the building.The facility is set in 60 acres of beautiful lawns,gardens and woodland on the banks of the Clyde. There is a remembrance book with appropriate inscriptions and remembrance trees and roses.The east and west chapel each seat 155 mourners. Daldowie is the busiest crematorium in Scotland with a rising annual total of 4000 funerals.75%of the funerals are from Lanark Division and 25% from Glasgow.Regionalisation gave the crematorium to Glasgow in 1975.With the scarcity of land for burials Daldowie satisfies an increasing demand for cremation from a magnificent setting.
